intro: Ipomopsis picta, commonly known as the painted ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to blue. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Ipomopsis picta plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
